borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>a) Notwithstanding the proposed cycle parking spaces and cycle store plan, no above ground works shall take place until revised drawings and documents showing:</p><ul><li>internal stands/racks allowing both the frame and at least one wheel of the bike to be secured within the cycle storage,&nbsp;</li><li>demonstrate that the cycle storage is sufficient&nbsp;to store all types of cycle,</li><li>demonstrate on site location plan that the cycle storage will be well located close to the entrance, and</li><li>demonstrate that the cycle parking will be fully covered.</li></ul><p>shall be submitted to and approved in writing&nbsp;by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>b) The approved cycle parking storage under part A of this condition&nbsp;shall be provided in full prior to the first occupation of the residential dwellings.&nbsp;The cycle storage arrangements shall thereafter be retained.</p>

<p style=""><span style="line-height: 115%;">Prior to commencement of the development, </span>including any works of demolition,&nbsp;<span style="line-height: 115%;">a Construction Logistics Plan (CLP) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. The details shall include the numbers, size and routes of construction vehicles, provisions within/around the site to ensure that all vehicles associated with the construction works are properly managed to prevent any unwanted disruption to other highway users, and other matters relating to traffic management to be agreed with the licencing officers of the council. Approved details shall be implemented throughout the project period and any changes to the document must be reported back to the council’s planning and highways department.&nbsp;</span><br></p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:</p><ul><li>N.A/2OG/101 Issue A - Existing and Proposed Plans - 15/08/2022</li><li>N.A/2OG/102&nbsp;Issue A - Existing and Proposed Plans - 15/08/2022</li><li>N.A/2OG/103&nbsp;Issue A - Existing and Proposed Roof Plans - 15/08/2022</li><li>N.A/2OG/104&nbsp;Issue A - Existing and Proposed Elevations - 15/08/2022</li><li>N.A/2OG/105&nbsp;Issue A - Existing and Proposed Elevations - 15/08/2022</li><li>N.A/2OG/106&nbsp;Issue A - Existing and Proposed Sections - 15/08/2022</li><li>N.A/2OG/107&nbsp;Issue A - Existing and Proposed Street Scene&nbsp;- 15/08/2022</li><li>N.A/2OG/109&nbsp;Issue A - Proposed Site Plan - 15/08/2022</li><li>Site Location Plan</li></ul><p>No other drawings or documents apply.</p>

<p><span style="line-height: 115%;">Prior to commencement of the development</span>, including any works of demolition, until a Construction Environmental Management Plan (CEMP)has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This Plan shall incorporate details of: </p><p style="margin-left:40px">a) the parking of vehicles of site operatives; </p><p style="margin-left:40px">b) loading and unloading of plant and materials; </p><p style="margin-left:40px">c) storage of plant and materials used in constructing the development; </p><p style="margin-left:40px">d) measures to control the emission of dust, dirt and emissions to air during construction; such measures to accord with the guidance provided in the document “The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition”, Mayor of London, July 2014; </p><p style="margin-left:40px">e) noise and vibration control; and </p><p style="margin-left:40px">f) a waste management plan for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works. </p><p>Demolition and construction work and associated activities, other than internal works inaudible outside the site boundary, are only to be carried out between the hours of 08:00 and 18:00 Monday to Friday and 08:00 and 13:00 Saturday, with no work on Sundays or public holidays without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority. </p><p>Any works which are associated with the generation of ground borne vibration are only to be carried out between the hours of 08:00 and 18:00 Monday to Friday. </p><p>Demolition and construction work and associated activities are to be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained within British Standard 5228:2009, “Code of practice for noise and vibration control on construction and open sites”, Parts 1 and 2. </p><p>Once approved the Plan shall be adhered to throughout the construction period for the development.</p>

<p>Prior to commencement of the development,&nbsp;including any works of demolition, an Air Quality Neutral assessment considering emissions from buildings and transport sources shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The assessment methodology used shall be in line with the GLA Air Quality Neutral Guidance 2023.<br></p><p><br></p>

<p>Notwithstanding the provisions of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no development falling within Classes A, B, C and E in Part 1 of Schedule 2 to that Order shall be carried out without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.<br></p>
The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing dwellinghouse.
The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
subdivision_of_building: LAND ADJACENT TO 2 OTTAWA GARDENS DAGENGHAM RM10 9YB
description: Construction of a 2x bed semi-detached dwelling with associated refuse and cycle storage adjacent to 2 Ottowa Gardens

constraints_details.result: 2 Ottawa Gardens, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM10 9YB
